extendedIngredients.name: pork tenderloin
extendedIngredients.originalString: 18 ounces Smithfield Teriyaki Marinated Fresh Pork Tenderloin

recipes.title: Bacon-Wrapped Teriyaki Pork Bites

winePairing.pairingText: Asian works really well with Riesling, Gewurztraminer, and Chenin Blanc. The best wine for Asian food depends on the cuisine and dish - of course - but these acidic whites pair with a number of traditional meals, spicy or not. The Pacific Rim Riesling with a 4.2 out of 5 star rating seems like a good match. It costs about 12 dollars per bottle.

productMatches.title: Pacific Rim Riesling
productMatches.description: Portraying bright crispness, subtle sweetness and aromas of jasmine, pear and apple, Pacific Rim Riesling exemplifies the harmony of Riesling. The sweetness plays wonderfully with fiery fare (from Thai to Mexican), while the natural acidity stands up to richer foods (from French to German).

recipes.instructions: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and place a baking rack on top of the foil. Spray rack with cooking spray.Cut slices of bacon in half crosswise (not lengthwise!). Cut pork tenderloin into chunks about 1" by 2". Wrap each chunk of pork with a slice of bacon, and place pork bites seam-side down on the prepared baking rack.Use a basting brush to coat the outside of each pork bite with teriyaki sauce. Bake in preheated oven approximately 20 minutes or until outer layers are well browned.

steps.step: Preheat oven to 400 degrees F. Line a baking sheet with aluminum foil, and place a baking rack on top of the foil. Spray rack with cooking spray.
Cut slices of bacon in half crosswise (not lengthwise!).

Cut pork tenderloin into chunks about 1" by 2". Wrap each chunk of pork with a slice of bacon, and place pork bites seam-side down on the prepared baking rack.Use a basting brush to coat the outside of each pork bite with teriyaki sauce.
Bake in preheated oven approximately 20 minutes or until outer layers are well browned.
